intro: Diplostephium wurdackii, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes. It is known for its milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested. This species is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
